docs.snippet: Five South American countries--Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay-- are beginning a study of the 1.2-million-square-mile Rio de la Plata basin to determine its potential for integrated development.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five South American countries--Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay-- are beginning a study of the 1.2-million-square-mile Rio de la Plata basin to determine its potential for integrated development.
docs.abstract: 5 S Amer countries begin $3-million study of basin to determine potential for integrated development; map; Inter-Amer Development Bank gives $250,000; other contributors listed

headline.main: 5 Latin Countries Start Basin Study Of Rio de la Plata; 5 NATIONS STUDY RIVER POTENTIAL

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 2(AP)-- A Congressional report said today that the Fidel Castro regime in Cuba supported guerrilla forces in four Latin American nations, plotted against others, and was also busily at work in Africa.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 2(AP)-- A Congressional report said today that the Fidel Castro regime in Cuba supported guerrilla forces in four Latin American nations, plotted against others, and was also busily at work in Africa.
docs.abstract: US HR subcom charges Cuba supports guerrilla forces in 4 Latin-Amer nations, plots against others there and in Africa, rept and recent testimony made pub by Repr Selden; repts Cuba sometimes trains, finances and equips forces and sends own experts to aid; terms Cuba-Mex air link major route for subversives, Uruguay key propaganda distribution center

headline.main: Castro Infiltrates 4 Latin Countries, House Report Says

docs.snippet: "LOOK. No seams!" a student boasted, holding aloft a dress she had recently completed.  Making a garment without visible seams is one of the proudest achievements of many students learning dress designing and clothing construction at the French...
docs.lead_paragraph: "LOOK. No seams!" a student boasted, holding aloft a dress she had recently completed. Making a garment without visible seams is one of the proudest achievements of many students learning dress designing and clothing construction at the French Fashion Academy, 600 Madison Avenue (near 57th Street).

headline.main: They Make Their Wardrobes as They Learn to Sew
SHIPPING MAILS ALL HOURS GIVEN IN DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME

docs.snippet: At Vifla del Mar in Chile--so far away in terms of the current preoccupations of Washington--a twoweek conference of the Inter-American Economic and Social Council (IA-ECOSOC) has recently ended. It was important to Latin America, now beginning the...
docs.lead_paragraph: At Vifla del Mar in Chile--so far away in terms of the current preoccupations of Washington--a twoweek conference of the Inter-American Economic and Social Council (IA-ECOSOC) has recently ended. It was important to Latin America, now beginning the long, long road to a hemispheric common market. It was marginal to the United States, because the Middle East and Vietnam bulk larger today than Chile and Brazil.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 7-- Winter is very cruel to  Buenos Aires. By the middle of June, the frigid Antarctic winds shake most of the foliage from the trees. The rain streaks the gray buildings and turns the narrow streets into quick little streams...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 7-- Winter is very cruel to Buenos Aires. By the middle of June, the frigid Antarctic winds shake most of the foliage from the trees. The rain streaks the gray buildings and turns the narrow streets into quick little streams bobbing with black umbrellas in the morning.
docs.abstract: Prices up sharply, Buenos Aires; Govt's difficulties in regulating mkt discussed; cartoon

headline.main: The Cruel July Winter; Argentines Encounter Trying Days And Some Are Stirring Up a Fuss
